sentences.en: A benign tumour will not cause you any fatal harm.
sentences.cn: 良性肿瘤不会对你有致命的伤害.

sentences.en: an operation on her lung to remove a tumour
sentences.cn: 为她做肺部肿瘤切除手术

sentences.en: He died in 1984 of an unsuspected brain tumour.
He was died of a malignant tumour.
He was suffering from a brain tumour.
It is not the primary tumour that kills, but secondary growths elsewhere in the body.
sentences.cn: 原发性肿瘤并不会置人于死地，致命的是身体其他部位的继发肿瘤。

sentences.en: It wasn't cancer, only a benign tumour.
sentences.cn: 这不是癌症，只是良性肿瘤。

sentences.en: The course of the disease correlates with the development of the tumour.
sentences.cn: 病程和肿瘤的发展有相互关系.

sentences.en: The dye is reduced by dehydrogenase enzymes released by viable tumour cells.
sentences.cn: 染料被存活的肿瘤细胞放出的脱氢酶所还原.

sentences.en: The surgeon cut away the tumour with expert skill.
sentences.cn: 外科大夫用熟练的技术把肿瘤切去.
外科医生用X射线照射那个肿瘤.

sentences.en: The surgeons operated on her for a tumour.
sentences.cn: 外科医生为她施行了肿瘤切除手术.

trans.tran_en: a mass of diseased cells in your body that have divided and increased too quickly
